Question
========
What is true of interval level data?

Answerlist
----------
* The appropriate descriptive statistics are mean and standard deviation.
* The mean, median, and mode are meaningful measures of central tendency.
* Zero is arbitrary.
* Addition and subtraction may be performed.
* Multiplication and division are not really appropriate.
* Usually psychometric measurements.
* The distance between measurement points is unknown and inconsistent.
* It is a categorical variable.
* It is the next to lowest level of measurement.


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* True.
* True.
* True.
* True.
* True.
* True.
* False.
* False.
* False.
